newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ shares close lower led down by Telecom.
newsitem.headline: NZ shares close lower led down by Telecom.

text.p: * New Zealand closes lower on 8 cent Telecom fall
* Turnover boosted by seven million BIL
* Buyers run out of steam
Price movements at close
LAST CHG
329 -2 * NZSC cap index -5.69 at 4,487.04
362 -5 * Volume NZ$71 million. Futures -9 at 1,121
695 -8 * Other movers - +15 -10
The New Zealand bourse closed lower on Wednesday thanks mainly to an eight cent slide in market heavyweight Telecom.
The NZSE-40 capital index closed 8.37 points lower at 2,235.25 on tunover of NZ$71 million.
Paul Davenport of brokers Doyle Paterson Brown said turnover was boosted by four million Telecom and seven million Brierley Investment shares crossing. He said profit taking was not an influence.
"You can't go on for ever. Buyers just ran out of steam."
He attributed a slight rise of three points in the index towards the close as buyers cleaning out their orders.
Tim Koller of brokers Hendry Hay McIntosh said Telecom was the standout stock closing at 695c.
He said concerns about market share in Australia continued to press down on brewer Lion Nathan, of five cents at $3.62.

"The market did not have such a strong tone today as yesterday after a good run of late. A little profit taking and interest rates going higher as well as the election drawing closer" affected sentiment, Koller said.
Utilities were still well-bought with Energy Direct up another nine cents to $3.34 while gas distributor Enerco gained 10 cents to $6.20.

Koller said TransAlta NZ's A/A1 credit rating by Standard & Poor's had helped Energy Direct. TransAlta NZ is the company to be formed from the proposed merger of Energy Direct and neighbouring energy company Capital Power.
Among secondliners, plastics and electrical supplier PDL Holdings rose 15 cents to $7.15 on the back of a forecast increase in profit to $12.4 million for the March 1997 year.
-- Vernon Small 64 4 4714 278.
